授業目的: The purpose of this course is to understand how and why innovation is occurring in Asian countries by deciphering recent international press coverage of industry and technology. Students will be able to understand the characteristics of innovative companies and economic policies in Asian countries and regions, and analyze current issues related to advanced technology and international politics from a unique perspective.
到達目標:
(1) Students will be able to explain the characteristics of innovation by Asian companies and its background in each country/region.
(2) To be able to deepen understanding of how Asian countries and major countries/regions in the world such as the United States and the European Union (EU) relate to each other in terms of industry and technology in light of the international situation.
(3) Students will develop the ability to judge the importance of various news reports on Asian industry and technology and to decipher them from their own unique perspectives.
特記事項:

However, if the course is originally not credited toward graduation, it will not be determined as subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses, regardless of the online format.
関連科目: European Innovation System, American Innovation System
授業の概要・背景: The Asian region has become the center of the world's economic growth. Deepening our understanding of the characteristics of the innovations that occur in this region, the realities of the companies that are responsible for these innovations, and the policies of each country that encourage business activities is important not only for the economy, but also for considering world affairs. Based on the lecturer's experience as a journalist engaged in international reporting, he will analyze the various aspects of innovation in each major Asian country and in each technological theme.
授業方法: The course will be conducted in a hybrid format of face-to-face and on-demand classes. In each class, recent news reports on cutting-edge technologies will be explained and their background and significance will be discussed. Face-to-face classes will include discussions on specific issues and opportunities for short presentations by students. Online in-class examinations will be scheduled.
